oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Carte de visite of Titus Rodgers
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Half-length studio portrait of Titus Rodgers wearing his Union uniform. He enlisted in Chicago in 1861 with his brother, Oliver. The family states that Titus was on Gen. Ulysses S. Grant's staff. He fought with Grant and Gen. William T. Sherman in Chattanooga and Atlanta. In civilian life, Titus was a bank teller. See also whit023 and whit025 for images of his brother Oliver Rodgers.
